intro: Afrocanthium, commonly known as the African crownbeard, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plants typically have hairy stems and leaves, with showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring. Afrocanthium species are often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
